Item.Name: ~ Walt Disney's BEAUTY AND THE BEAST! VHS
Item.Description: ~ Walt Disney's BEAUTY AND THE BEAST! VHS VIDEO TAPE ~ A modern movie masterpiece, Disney's Beauty and the Beast waltzed away with six Academy Award nominations including Best Picture -- the first ever for an animated film. Along with winning the prestigious Best Picture Golden Globe Award, it now ranks among history's most highly acclaimed cinematic achievements. When the film's beautiful book-loving heroine, Belle, sings the first of an unprecedented three Oscar-nominated songs, you too will fall instantly under its spell. However, it is the spell of an enchantress that opens this classic fairy talk, turning a cruel prince into a hideous beast. His stubborn pride compels him to remain in his bewitched castle -- inhabited by Lumiere the lovestruck candelabra, Cogsworth the pompous clock, the kindly Mrs. Potts, and an inquisitive little teacup named Chip. To break the spell, the Beast must win Belle's love before the last petal falls from an enchanted rose. With a colorful cast of endearing Disney characters, Beauty and the beast will enthrall both young and old, forever reminding us that true beauty comes from within. Tape in great condition - box in good shape. Approximate running time: 84 minutes - NTSC **I currently have several SALE items with low opening bids of $1.49** Please check my other auctions, if you're interested... Item.Name: LITTLE HOUSE ON THE PRAIRIE (FULL LENGTH)
Item.Description: This is a special full-length feature video of Little House on the Prairie (The Lord is My Shepherd). The movie stars Micheal Landon, Karen Grassle, Melissa Gilbert Melissa Sue Anderson. It also has a special guest star Ernest Borgnine. The movie is in wonderful shape. This is one of the all-time classic Little House on the prairie programs. Laura Ingalls learns an important lesson in love from a kind-hearted hermit (Ernest Borgnine), in the unforgettable THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD, a feature-length drama from "LITTLE HOUSE ON THE PRAIRIE". Laura (Melissa Gilbert), daughter of Charles and Caroline Ingalls (Michael Landon, Karen Grassle), is afraid the newest addition to her family, a baby boy, will replace her father's affections. When the baby becomes ill, Laura refuses to pray for the infant who eventually dies. Overwhelmed with guilt, Laura runs away to the mountains where shee meets and confides in Jonathan (Borgnine), a sensitive recluse. While caring for Laura, Jonathan helps the young girl to understand the death was not her fault, and that her family loves and needs her. Meanwhile, a panicked Charles searches in vain for Laura until an incredible sign leads him to her an emotionally charged reunion. Written and directed by Michael Landon, THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD is superb entertainment for the entire family. You will not want to miss this classic. Buyer will pay $2.00 for shipping and handling. Paypal is welcome to. Please look at my other auctions on ebay at dmgbag@aol.com. Thanks again. Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Item.Name: Amaz Spider-man LiveAction 1977 RARE OOP
Item.Description: Amazing Spiderman Live Action Movie 1977 RARE OOP The Amazing Spider-man The Fascinating Adventures of a Comic Book Hero! The adventures of freelance photographer Peter Parker, who, after being bitten by a radioactive spider, discovered he had gained superpowers, such as super-strength and agility and the ability to climb sheer walls and ceilings. After inventing a super-sticky web serum, he donned a red-and-black costume, and began fighting crime as the superhero Spider-Man. During the day, Parker worked for the Daily Bugle and skinflint editor J. Jonah Jameson. Live Action - Not Animated 1977 Running Time: 94 minutes Color Cast overview: Nicholas Hammond (I) .... Spider-Man/Peter Parker Dick Balduzzi .... Delivery Man Barry Cutler .... Purse Snatcher Thayer David .... Edward Byron Jeff Donnell .... Aunt May Parker Lisa Eilbacher .... Item.Description: Elmo's World - Babies, Dogs & More VHS NEW, Factory Sealed. This item is obtained directly from our authorized wholesale distributor. It is new and unopened, in the original factory shrink wrap. These are not dubbed or copied, but are the genuine products available here in the U.S. Please beware of others' "copied" products. Elmo's World - Babies, Dogs & More VHS Set o Starring: Elmo o NTSC format (US and Canada only) o Color, Closed-captioned, NTSC Sesame Street's cheerful redhead chuckles his way through this delightful 50-minute compilation of three favorite "Elmo's World" episodes. First come the babies: real babies, Muppet babies, and animal babies. With help from Mister Noodle, a cast of Muppets, and video vignettes featuring humans, Elmo discovers what babies can do and how to play with them. Next come the dogs. Once again, Elmo's on the move--this time to share important tips about respecting the family pet. The final episode examines life on the farm. Viewers will observe youngsters accomplishing daily farm chores as well as Muppet farmers and barn animals punning around. As Elmo bops around his house (simply drawn and "furnished" with color crayon sketches), he chats with Dorothy the pet goldfish, poses questions to Mister Noodle, and tunes in to his friendly television for helpful cartoons presented by "The Baby Channel," "The Dog Channel," and of course, "The Farm Channel." Educational and entertaining for the younger crowd, each segment explores its topic using a variety of creative, quick-paced methods, enhanced by an upbeat soundtrack. From the moment we put this video in the VCR, my then-baby, now-toddler, loved this video. She runs up to the television to hug Elmo, and plays peek-a-boo with him in front of the set. When my husband or I are alone with her, we can pop the video in the VCR, put her in her crib, and take a quiet shower while she watches Elmo for 15 minutes. This is by far the best video we have for her, and highly recommend it to any parent who needs 5 or 10 minutes of "breathe time" to occupy an otherwise inconsolable toddler. From his boyhood love of baseball, to his distinguished career as a college track and football star, to his time in the Negro Leagues, and on to his signing with the Brooklyn Dodgers. Item.Name: The Partridge Family Cast SIGNED Rare Bus Pic
Item.Description: The Partridge Family was the '70s successor to the Monkees. Both were totally fictional rock/pop "bands" produced by Screen Gems, the television branch of Columbia Pictures. While the Monkees (TV series and band concept) were styled as mid-'60s counter-culture zaniness _ la the Beatles' film Hard Days Night, the Partridge Family was strictly wholesome with traditional family values despite the lite quasi-hip tone of the show. The top-rated series first-aired on ABC from 1970 to 1974, premiering September 25, 1970. Besides the face and voice of David Cassidy ,one of the other draws of the show was the uncanny deadpan timing of Danny Bonaduce as Danny Partridge and the simmering neurosis of the group's manager Reuben Kincaid as played by Dave Madden. When sharing a scene together, the two were hysterical. Starring stage and screen veteran Shirley Jones and then up-and-coming actor David Cassidy, The Partridge Family was loosely based on real-life family pop/rock band the Cowsills ("Hair," "The Rain, The Park & Other Things," "Indian Lake," "Love American Style"). The other Partridge siblings were Susan Dey as Laurie, Suzanne Crough as Tracy, and Jeremy Gelbwaks as Chris during the first season. Gelbwaks' parents felt uncomfortable with the ensuing mania that surrounded the show and took the youngster out of the cast. He was replaced in the role by Brian Foster. Don't miss out on your chance to bid on this muscial cult favorite pictured here in their Mondrian-esque bus. This extremely rare reproduction is signed by Shirley Jones, Susan Dey & David Cassidy & is offered (here) at an unbelievable low minimum bid. Winning bid to add $5.00 for postage & handling. PLEASE NOTE - YOUR BID WILL NOT INCLUDE MATTING, NOR WILL IT INCLUDE FRAMING. *** PayPal(s) are always welcomed - Username: wllmw3@aol.com *** Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Item.Name: DRUNKEN MASTER DVD LTBX ~ JACKIE CHAN - NEW
Item.Description: FRONT ROW ENTERTAINMENT PRESENTS "DRUNKEN MASTER" LETTERBOXED EDITION Starring JACKIE CHAN See the movie that propelled Jackie Chan to stardom. Truly a classic and a must see film for Jackie Chan fans around the world. Jackie Chan stars as Freddy, a wisecracking but good-hearted young man. One day he beats a local bully who was harassing a poor man in the market. The bully's father complains to Freddy's father, insisting on repayment of the damages done. Freddy has already been a handful for his father, Master Wong, so this latest incident is the last straw. In order to teach Freddy a lesson, Master Wong seeks out Sam Seed, a hard-driving kung-fu master who has a reputation for breaking his students. Freddy's friends warn him about the teacher's reputation so he heads for the hills. Unfortunately the eccentric old man he meets in a restaurant just happens to be Sam Seed himself. Seeds drills Freddy mercilessly for months, and Freddy makes many attempts to escape. Eventually Sam Seed shares the secret of his unusual fighting style-liquor! Filled with the spectacular stunts and broad slapstick that have become Jackie Chan's trademark, DRUNKEN MASTER is a hilarious and appealing martial arts film. Item.Name: CARICATURE VICTOR BORGE 1945 Auerbach-Levy
Item.Description: William Auerbach-Levy (1889-1964) VICTOR BORGE IN CONCERT 1945 Born in Russia, Auerbach-Levy spent his career in New York City during the golden age of celebrity caricature in the first half of the 20th Century. In those years, caricaturists found an avid audience in the readers of magazines including VANITY FAIR and THE NEW YORKER. It was the beginning of the modern cult of celebrity. Auerbach-Levy was in the center of the action in New York and drew caricatures of some of the most famous celebrities of the day. This is a high quality lithographic poster published in 1977 promoting the Auerbach-Levy collection of drawings at the Museum of the City of New York. Auerbach-Levy's original drawing from 1924 was deftly executed with brush and ink. The freshness of his brushstrokes and line are beautifully captured by the lithography of the original. Overall size is 28" by 22". Condition: 33 year old poster, paper has slightly greyed. This piece is printed on high-quality paper. It far exceeds the quality of a normal poster. Item.Name: WHEN HARRY MET SALLY - DVD Sealed LOW SHIP
Item.Location: CHECK MY FEEDBACK & BID WITH CONFIDENCE ...
Item.Description: WHEN HARRY MET SALLY _ DVD _Tender, Amazing &Magnificent!_ SPECIAL EDITION _ Great Special Features! Brand New & Factory Sealed There is NO RESERVE on this auction _ Check my eBay feedback profile and bid with confidence! Starring: Meg Ryan, Billy Crystal, Carrie Fisher Includes Music Video by Harry Connick Jr.! "Brimming over with style, intelligence and flashing wit" (Rolling Stone), this "splendid and irresistible" (Los Angeles Times) film from director Rob Reiner (The American President) is one of the best-loved romantic comedies of all time. Featuring dazzling performances from Meg Ryan, Billy Crystal, Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby, exceptional music from Harry Connick Jr., and an Oscar-nominated screenplay by Nora Ephron, When Harry Met Sally is an "explosively funny" (Newsweek) commentary on friendships, courtships -- and other hardships -- of the modern age. Will sex ruin a perfect relationship between a man and a woman? That's what Harry (Crystal) and Sally (Ryan) debate during their trip from Chicago to New York. And eleven years later, they're still no closer to finding the answer. Will these two best friends ever accept that they're meant for each other or will they continue to deny the attraction that's existed since the first moment When Harry Met Sally? Features: - Over 7 Minutes of Never-Before-Seen Footage - Audio Commentary with Director Rob Reiner - "Making-Of" Documentary with Rob Reiner, Nora Ephron, Billy Crystal, Carrie Fisher and Cast & Crew - Music Video by Harry Connick, Jr. - Original Theatrical Trailer - Anamorphic Widescreen - Dolby Digital Surround Sound SHIPPING IS ONLY $2.90 ... Item.Name: WONDERFUL CHARACTER LAMP
Item.Description: This lamp is so Neat!! We found this upon moving, in an outback shed--it is an OLDIE!! This is apparently hand made ceramic. Works great. This has eight characters on it, and double sided, both sides have the same eight characters, from Frankenstein, Dracula, Laurel and Hardy, and others(maybe you know who they are). We can't decide the other characters. The top of the lamp is an old style film maker (camera) with the handle. This is approx. 30 inches tall without a shade on it(doesn't come with a shade or bulb). There are some paint chips, which I am sure could be touched up. There is a chip in the camera itself, maybe a small fill in and a touch of paint. The pink hat on the woman has also got a small chip, I would say same as camera(could be fixed nicely). There are no actual Cracks anywhere that I have found. I think it is a Wonderful memorabilia item for the movie lovers out there!! Payment can be made with credit card/checks via Paypal, Money order, cashiers check can be mailed. Take a look and see what you think. Sorry about the glare in some of the pictures. Buyer pays shipping (and insurance if desired) for this heavy piece. Have a Great Day and Happy Bidding!!!

Item.Name: Angie (1994) Geena Davis, James Gandolfini
Item.Description: Angie (1994) Geena Davis, James Gandolfini Previously viewed VHS tape; original tape in very good playing condition; original box is missing, cardboard sleeve provided to protect box. Description: In Bensonhurst, Brooklyn, a woman does what she's expected to--especially if she's expecting. Angie (Geena Davis) is just a little too independent for that, and when her long-time boyfriend gets her pregnant she decides to do things entirely her own way, shocking everyone in this often comedic look at one woman's search for self. This heartwarming story is based on the novel ANGIE, I SAYS by Avra Wing. Apparently Madonna was up for the role of Angie and was dismissed in favor of Geena Davis. The rumor is that Madonna therefore wrote an angry, sarcastic letter on this topic to Disney, and producer Joe Roth, claiming she had initiated the project with writer Todd Graff. Disney maintained that Madonna, attached from the beginning, had opted to do the film SNAKE EYES (aka DANGEROUS GAME) instead.James Gandolfini (Vinnie) and Aida Turturro (Tina) played brother and sister on the HBO series THE SOPRANOS. The first, Magnetic Rose, is about the legacy of an opera singer, and the terrible secret she leaves in space, as the crew of a salvage ship must try to find a way to survive entering her memories. Stink Bomb is about a hapless Japanese researcher fighting a simple cold, whose remedy is truly far worse than the original illness. Cannon Fodder revolves around the life of a boy who lives in a socialist city of cannons, where everyone's place and duty is set for life. Otomo himself is credited as director for the third segment, acting as supervisor for the first two. Memories is INCREDIBLE, while the writing and stories are truely unique and well done. The anime is by Katsuhrio Otomo who is probably best known for his creation of Akira!! These VCD's are English Subbed and in A+ quality!! They can be played on a DVD/VCD player with MPEG capablities...please check to make sure your DVD player can play this format...if you are still unsure then contact me and I'll let you know!! Item.Name: SESAME STREET VISITS THE HOSPITAL New VHS
Item.Description: SESAME STREET VISITS THE HOSPITAL In Color With Closed Captioning. New VHS Serious bidders only please, if you don_t intend to pay please don_t bid. This video is BRAND NEW and still sealed in the factory wrap. The holidays are not very far away and this video would make a great stocking stuffer! Box description: When Big Bird wakes up feeling sick, Maria takes him to the hospital. It_s pretty frightening at first, but he soon learns that everyone at the hospital is working to make him feel better. Come along with Big Bird as the doctors and nurses at the hospital give him a blood test, an x-ray, and his own special ID bracelet. With everyone_s help, Big Bird discovers that the hospital isn_t so scary after all, and he makes a healthy return home to all his friends on Sesame Street. Note To Parents: The hospital can be a very frightening place for young children, but visiting or staying in the hospital need not be traumatic if children are prepared for the experience. By openly discussing the hospital environment, what to expect there, and your child_s specific concerns, you can help alleviate his or her fears. This entertaining and reassuring video will help show children what a hospital is and what to expect when they or those they love stay there. Item.Name: Lucille Ball- Mame Contact Sheet- Very Rare!
Item.Description: WOW! Super Rare- This is an absolutely incredible piece of motion picture history! This contact sheet contains 19 frame by frame pictures from the TITLE SCENE! Frames 6718-6736 clearly depict Lucille Ball and Robert Preston singing and dancing to the title song, Mame. The sheet is 11" x 14", and each frame is 2.5" x 1.75" This contact sheet is dated 4-6-73, and was used by those promoting the movie to determine which shots would be used for publicity pictures. Some of the frames have orange crayon markings on them, to distinguish frames which would not be used in the final prints. Frame 6735 contains a double hole punch beneath it, as well as two ruled pen markings (one on each side). The sheet itself is in nice condition, though the backside has some minor folding along one edge. The scan doesn't do it justice, because the whole sheet was too large for my scanner. There are an additional 7 and a half frames that did not fit in the scan. This is an unbelievable piece, and extremely rare! If you are a motion picture collector or Lucille Ball collector, you have just struck gold! This is a unique item that you can add to your collection, and be relatively sure there is nothing else quite like it! Buyer to pay shipping. International shipping will be higher. Payment Due within 10 days of auction end. PayPal, BidPay, BillPoint and Money Orders for payment.

Item.Name: Queer as Folk Cast Leather Jacket - Vince
Item.Description: Queer as Folk Cast Leather Jacket - Vince This is a Cast Jacket from the British Hit Series Queer As Folk. The Jacket has the Character Name Vince on the front and the Actor Name Craig Kelly on the back. Queer as Folk, the Whole Love Thing Sorted is embroidered on the front On the sleeve it says Channel Four Television, London It is a Suede two tone jacket black with charcoal grey sleeves. Quilted lining with a inner pocket Size Large - Condition New. Queer As Folk first hit the screens of the UK on Channel 4 in February 1998 and is an eight-part drama serial that follows the lives and loves of three young men Stuart (Aidan Gillen), his best mate Vince (Craig Kelly) and Nathan (Charlie Hunnam) living it large in Manchester's Canal Street 'gay village'. Vince knows tv and movie trivia especially Doctor Who and Coronation Street. Only has eyes for Stuart and is the caring one out of the whole group. Item.Name: The Magic Flute Laserdisc LD Bergman Mozart
Item.Description: You are bidding on a previously viewed laserdisc of Ingmar Bergman's "The Magic Flute" with the music of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. No Reserve!!! Mozart's "The Magic Flute" premiered in 1791, and to this day it remains as one of the most delightfully humorous and enchanting operas of all time. Mozart tells the story of a handsome young prince's quest to save a beautiful princess from the forces of evil. It's a marvelous tale of mysticism, good vs. bad, and the power of love. This filmed version conceived, produced and directed by master filmmaker Ingmar Bergman, is a one of a kind joyous tribute to Mozart's musical mastery. 2 DISCS. 1973, Color, 134 minutes, Stereo. Performed In Swedish With English Subtitles. A GREAT laserdisc to add to any collection! Lucky Bidder pays $7 additional for priority shipping, insurance and delivery confirmation WITHIN the United States. Thank You and Good Luck!

Item.Description: Tarzan 5 Volume VHS Box Set on VHS New and Sealed Tarzan And The Green Goddess Released: 1938/ Running Time: 68 Minutes/ Directed By: Edward Kull Starring: Herman Brix (Bruce Bennett), Ula Holt, Frank Baker, Don Castello, Lewis Sargent This is the sequel to "The Adventures Of Tarzan." Deep in the Guatemalan jungle are the ruins of an ancient Mayan civilization. The natives there guard a sacred idol called The Green Goddess. But the natives are unaware that hidden inside the idol is a secret Mayan formula for a super explosive that can destroy whole cities. Thieves steal The Green Goddess from the high alter with plans of selling the formula for millions of dollars. Tarzan's expedition steals the idol from the thieves and plan on putting it where it can't fall into the wrong hands. Henry Gordon, Hedda Hopper, George Meeker Olympic Decathalon champ Glenn Morris plays the vine swinging Tarzan in this adventure about an evil African ruler who covets perky Eleanor Holm (who is a champion swimmer herself.) Item.Name: SERGEANT YORK--Gary Cooper--RARE--NEW--RARE
Item.Description: Movies SERGEANT YORK New and Factory Sealed With a backbone made strong from tilling rocky farmland, a trigger finger made precise by hunting wild game, it's no wonder that Alvin C. York became a superior soldier. In fact, despite his moral objection to war, York became the most decorated man of WW I, earning his medals on the battlefields of Argonne when he single-handedly extinguished a German machine gun squadron armed with only a Springfeild rifle and a Colt .45 pistol. A pacifist turned patriot, York became not only a daring freedom fighter, but also one our nation's most revered heroes! Based on a true story and nominated for 11 Academy Awards, this "powerful and engrossing" (Look) WW I classic is an honest and fitting tribute to heroism that is further distinguished by the Oscar winning performance of the remarkable Gary Cooper. Gary Cooper Walter Brennan Joan Leslie George Tobias Stanley Ridges FACTS FROM THE VAULT Because WW II was approaching, York, after holding out for 23 years, agreed to let his life story be told on the condition that Gary Cooper play the lead. Mounted on a steel turntable so that 16 angles of it could be filmed, the 40-foot peak that york ascends to contemplate war was built from canvas and wood Select battle scenes were shot on an 80-acre barley farm that was strewn with charred tree trunks and made to look war-torn by five tons of dynamite. Item.Description: Presents another fine auction... Nazca: Blades of Fate DVD Pioneer Can a past life affect the future? Kyoji, the only member of a small Kendo (traditional Japanese wooden swordplay) club has his world turned upside down! Sudden visions of past life events during the age of the Incas revive ancient rivalries and ambitions, clouding modern day relationships and turning friends into deadly enemies! Kyoji's former mentor, Tate fully accepts his past life as Yawaru, an Inca warrior, and has adopted his old ambition to cleanse the world of its weaker elements. However, he also remembers it was the betrayal of Biruka, Kyoji's past life, that thwarted his original attempt! Does the past really play an important role in the future? Nazca is a story of past lives and present conflicts. A story of friendships shattered and reformed by events that happened hundreds of years ago during the days of the Incas! Item.Name: Tim Conway in DORF ON GOLF VHS
Item.Description: " A Short Course For the Serious Golfer " " Nobody Does it like Derk Dorf (Thank God !) " " From the broad strokes to the fine points, Tim Conway teaches golf the "Derk Dorf way" and ... we promise you ... your game will never be the same. " " In DORF ON GOLF, an athlete of some stature gives you startling insights (and ridiculous conclusions!) You'll see Dorf's revolutionary inventions that keep heads down, elbows in and drives straight and true. " " You'll meet Derk's "helpers," the bodacious Boom Boom LaRue and his erstwhile caddy, Leonard - tall as a tree and just as intelligent. (These folks give new meanings to the word "handicap") " " From tee to green, Derk shows you how to dress, how to drive, how to putt, how to cheat, how to find the 19th hole. He'll show you how to warm up, how to cool down and how to lose your cool. " " As a famous golfer once said, " Golf's too important to take seriously." If you (or the golfer in your life) are really serious about golf, DORF ON GOLF is the perfect antidote. Item.Name: Monty Python & the Holy Grail Script Book
Item.Description: Monty Python & the Holy Grail Script Book In good condition, with just a couple of bent corners in the first pages, this book is a copy of the First Draft of the infamous Monty Python movie. It includes changes to the script, letters to the directors and handwritten notes, even a few pictures and a statement of the cost of production for the movie. There is no date on the book, but several of the items in the book are dated in the 1970's and it does have the date 1977 on the back cover. It's definately a book for the fans of Monty Python - would make an unusual Christmas gift. From a non smoking home. Please email me with any questions and thanks for looking. Item.Name: SINGLES Video VHS Bridget Fonda Matt Dillon
Item.Description: This Warner Bros. 100 minute, color, VHS video with Dolby Surround sound, entitled, "Singles", is in excellent condition having only been played a few times. A stellar cast joins writer/director Cameron Crowe (Jerry Maguire) in this sweet, funny, romantic comedy of Seattle twentysomethings searching for - and running from - love. Among the players: Matt Dillon as a romantically aloof rocker, Bridget Fonda as a lovestruck neighbor who hopes to get him to change his tune, plus Kyra Sedgwick, Campbell Scott, Sheila Kelly, and Bill Pullman. Adding to the excitement of "Singles" in its much-acclaimed million-selling Epic Soundtrax album, Seattle superstars Alice In Chains and Soundgarden perform live, members of Pearl Jam appear in cameos, and many other top bands including Paul Westerberg, Screaming Trees, Chris Cornell, Smashing Pumpkins, Mudhoney, Mother Loves Bone, The Lovemongers, and Jimi Hendrix, are featured throughout. Bonus: Two favorite outtake scenes of writer/director Cameron Crowe follow the feature. Rated PG-13 for language. Payment is due within 10 days of auction closing. Item.Name: Cuban movie poster"Ghost Rider"CUBA.Bachs
Item.Description: Untitled Document Cuban movie posters feature vibrant colors and an unusual look, making them almost appear to be hand-painted works of art rather than silkscreen posters. The paint is applied with heavy coats and the effect is quite striking. Cuba is still producing some of these posters and the process is totally hand made. I divided these posters in two categories: original and reprinted . Original posters were printed the year the artist designed them, in small quantities (25-250) and most will not be reprinted again due to many factors (copyright legalities on the movie, lost of original screen etc).These are the most valuable for the collectors. Small tears around the white borders and yellowish color of the paper are considered normal for these original posters. Notice that these posters, unlike U.S movie posters are NOT folded and I send them rolled and ready to frame, eliminating the need of mounting on linen to be displayed. Reprints are newer posters produced by ICAIC (Cuban Institute of Art and Cinema) after 1995 when the cuban government began to sell to tourists. They are equally beautiful and impresive, hand made and limited in their editions. In 1991, the Center for Cuban Studies in New York spearheaded a successful lawsuit against the U.S. Treasury Department, which made the importation and sale of original art from Cuba legal. I do not sale cuban posters for a living. My husband and I have a very large collection that we adquired in Cuba and some other countries. We also trade with other collectors around the world. We only sell those we have duplicates and we use that money to adquire more posters for our collection. Title: Jinete Fantasma (Ghost Horserider) Year: 1971. (original) Artist: Munoz Bachs Medium: Silkscreen . Cuban posters feature vibrant colors and an unusual look, making them almost appear to be hand-painted works of art rather than printed posters. The paint is applied with heavy coats. The effect is quite striking. Condition: Very Good (note that small tears around white borders, yellowish color of the paper (when original first run) and small imperfections in the inks are often normal in cuban posters since they are handmade.If some other imperfections are present I will write it as part of the description.Truly collectable and beautifully preserved. Payment methods : Money orders, checks, Billpoint (for credit card users) and PayPal (cubanposters@aol.com) name: Irina. Please , after end of auction I normally contact the highest bidder but sometimes I have to handle so many auctions that I loose track. Try to make contact with me at the end of the auction. Shipping: United States $7 priority mail w/ confirmation receipt--- International $15 airmail (I am not responsible for lost items in other countries but I always ask for a receipt of mailing as proof) ---- International with insurance $25 (I will return money or replace poster) YOU ONLY HAVE TO PAY THIS ONE TIME CHARGE NO MATTER HOW MANY POSTERS YOU BUY AS THEY CAN BE SHIPPED TOGETHER ,SO PLEASE LOOK AT : MY OTHER AUCTIONS Collecting cuban posters is a good investment idea and still inexpensive compared to high art. They are getting more and more scarce by the day and many of them are reaching very high prices. Cuba will eventually stop producing these wonderful posters because their limitations and cost. Any of these posters will make an unusual gift . For more information and facts about cuban posters please visit my webpage at: www.artofcuba.com Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Payment Instructions See item description or contact seller for more information.

Item.Name: Cindy Crawford Signed 8x10 WCOA # 52
Item.Description: Cindy Crawford Signed 8x10 WCOA # 52 (Click to Enlarge) Chicago's Best is proud to offer this highly collectible, genuinely hand signed 8 x 10 that would be the pride of anyones collection. All autographs are crisp and sharp, providing excellent contrast to the photo on which they are placed. For years, our primary offering in signature items has been Playboy and other mature material, guaranteed signed by the various celebrities that we carry in our photo stock. We often mail directly to the stars as we have the personal mailing address' of thousands of famous individuals. About half of our photos are sent to them by us for genuine autographs, and the remainder of our stock is what we buy and trade via international dealers, autograph clubs, and the private seller. With this in mind we can guarantee that all of our products are GENUINE and AUTHENTIC and will come with a certificate of authenticity personally signed by the president of our company. We are proud of what we sell, and will stand by our products 100%. Due to our numerous contacts in the entertainment and hotel industry we are constantly receiving new and rare items for your enjoyment. not to mention more in-person collectors than any other dealer on the internet. As a result we may have multiples of a particular item, therefore, the scan shown MAY BE a representative scan of the item up for auction. Don't be fooled by cheap imitations, buy it from Chicago's Best-proudly serving the collecting community since 1990. Don't delay-bid today PLEASE NOTE : We do not support eBay's new Checkout feature. You will receive information about payment at auction's close. Again, DO NOT go through eBay's Checkout. Please read our NEW shipping policy carefully. Due to the problem's in the past with the USPS and having too many item's lost and or damaged, NOW for Domestic shipping we use UPS and you will receive from UPS the tracking number and Insurance as part of the shipping and handling charge. UPS does NOT ship to P.O. Box's so please send the address for shipping. *** U.S. Customers will pay S/H $6.50 and will be mailed through the UPS Ground Delivery. When the item has been sent UPS will email you with the tracking information, and as always UPS insures all item's up to 100.00, but they will NOT send to a post office box so please include your shipping information. *** Canadian Customer's will pay S/H $6.50 sent Airmail through the United States Postal Service which does include insurance up to 50.00. *** International Customer's will pay S/H of $10.50 sent Airmail through the United States Postal Service which does include Insurance up to 50.00 These are our shipping policy's, and we are sorry that they are like this but we can NOT be liable for anything that has been lost or damaged once it has left our hand's. This is for everybody's protection to make sure that they get their item's in safe and fast condition. Payment is due within 7 day's after auction closes by Paypal, Bidpay, Payingfast, Money Order or cash at your own risk. If you have a feedback of ( 30 ) or higher you may pay by Check but item will be held until check clear's. NSF check's will be charged $35.00 bank fee, so make good because we do prosecute for bad check's... I prefer PayPal payments! Item.Name: ONE OF OUR AIRCRAFT IS MISSING VHS ~SEALED~
Item.Description: One Of Our Aircraft Is Missing VHS. This video is brand spanking new and is STILL FACTORY SEALED. Starring Godfrey Tearle and Eric Portman. 1941. 106 minutes. Black & White. REVIEW: The year: 1941 The day: Sunday The hour: Morning 04:31 hours This is the story of B for Bertie, a British Bomber that was struck by artillery fire over Stuttgart, Germany. The six man crew was able to turn the plane toward Holland before they were forced to bail out. They came down in the Netherlands within miles of the Zuider Zee. With the determined assistance of the Dutch resistance the entire crew is passed from hand to hand through the German lines until they reached the North Sea. Soon they were back in England. The Dutch have a saying.... the sea is a common enemy and against a common enemy one must unite. Five of the Dutch resistance were executed for the assistance that they gave to the British Air Crew. The attached picture will tell the rest of the story. NO RESERVE! YOUR FIRST BID COULD BE THE WINNING BID!!!!! WINNING BIDDER PLEASE INCLUDE $3.50 FOR SHIPPING AND HANDLING. PAYPAL IS ACCEPTED. Item.Name: STAR TREK
Item.Description: STAR TREK Boxed set of Star Trek movies Perfect Christmas Present for your favorite Star Trek fan!! Six movies including: Star Trek--The Motion Picture: The crew of the Enterprise is reunited to combat a lethal force field headed toward Earth. Slow, talky, and derivative, somewhat redeemed by terrific special effects and majestic Jerry Goldsmith score; still, mainly for purists. Network and videocassette version--generally considered an improvement--runs 143m. Followed by many sequels--and several new TV series! Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan: Kirk and the Enterprise crew must do battle with the nefarious villain of 1967's ``Space Seed'' episode. A bit hokey and pretentious at times, but a likable adventure overall, with nice touches of warmth and humor. Footage added for network showings. Originally released without the ``II'' in its title. Star Trek III: The Search for Spock: Picking up where #2 left off, Kirk reassembles his crew and shanghais the Enterprise to try and rescue Spock--in whatever form he may still be alive--while both he and the rapidly destructing Genesis Planet are endangered by a Klingon warship (led by Lloyd, in an ineffectual performance). Subdued sci-fi outing very much in keeping with tone of the original TV series... and therefore, recommended most heartily to Star Trek fans. Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home: The Enterprise crew takes a sharp left turn toward comedy in this uncharacteristic--and very entertaining--movie. Story has the familiar characters time-traveling back to the 20th century in order to save the Earth of the future, with the help of some humpback whales. Sheer novelty of the comic tone excuses some forays into the obvious; it's all in fun. Star Trek V: The Final Frontier: The Enterprise crew takes off on an emergency mission when an apparent madman takes over a distant planet and holds its interstellar ambassadors hostage; his motives, however, turn out to be anything but terroristic. Dramatically shaky trek starts off with a case of the cutes, and gets worse before it (finally) gets better. A weak entry in the series. Shatner's feature-film directing debut; he also shares story credit. Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country: The Enterprise crew is assigned to negotiate truce with Klingon leader, only to fall prey to a trap set by one of his renegade cohorts (Plummer, in a deliciously flamboyant performance). Entertaining saga cowritten by director Meyer. Nimoy helped concoct the story and also executive produced. Video version has 2 minutes of additional footage. Item.Name: THAT GIRL vhs/Rob Reiner/Ethel Merman/NEW!
Item.Description: That Girl "Guest Stars" New, Factory Sealed Vhs! This compilation includes three episodes highlighting some of the great talents who appeared on THAT GIRL over the years. In "The Liggle Piggy Had A Ball," guest starring TERI GARR and ROB REINER, Ann is asked to accept a Toni Award for her friend who must fly to Hollywood on the day of the awards. But after reading an article about a man getting his toe stuck in a bowling ball, Ann is experimenting and gets her toe stuck too. When all efforts to free her foot fail, she is forced to thump her way up to the dais in a fancy hairdo, evening gown and bowling ball! Episode two, "Pass The Potatoes, Ethel Merman" finds Ann overwhelmed to be appearing in a walk-on part on stage with ETHEL MERMAN. After being tongue-tied and applauding inappropriately the first-day of rehearsals, Ann avoids Miss Merman in embarrassment. Donald, trying to be helpful, invites the star to dinner at Ann's apartment, where her presence attracts the attention of all the neighbors. In "Those Friars," Ann is surprised when her late Uncle Harry wills her his old trunk of stage clothes. But she is doubly surprised when celebrities MILTON BERLE and DANNY THOMAS pay a visit toher apartment and try to buy the trunk. Color/75 min./Not Rated; Condition: New. Item.Name: Pretty Woman/VHS/1990/Richard Gere
Item.Description: Pretty Woman Release Year: 1990 By: CAST: RICHARD GERE Publisher: Director: Garry Marshall Categories: Comedy, Romance Rated: (Brief Nudity, Adult Situations, Not For Children, Explicit Language, Profanity ) Running Time: 117 minutes Condition: EXCELLENT / PREVIOUSLY VIEWED Self-involved corporate raider Edward Lewis (Richard Gere has recently split up with his girlfriend. Seeking directions to the Beverly Hills Hotel, he makes the acquaintance of free-spirited hooker Vivian Ward (Julia Roberts and decides to put her on a $3000 retainer as his "date." He Cinderellarizes her by bankrolling a full wardrobe and cosmetic makeover. Of course, the set-up will be strictly platonic. A disarming modern-day fairy tale, Pretty Woman was the picture that made Julia Roberts a superstar. As charming as she is in her "giggling" sequences, Roberts' best scene is her triumphant return to a posh Rodeo Drive shop where she'd been previously snubbed. Keeping Pretty Woman afloat throughout is the buoyant direction of Garry Marshall and the always welcome presence of Marshall's stock company of actors, including Hector Elizondo as a stuffy but golden-hearted concierge. Pretty Woman began its life as a much darker story of prostitutes and homicidal drug dealers, but more box-office-savvy heads ultimately prevailed. [images are actual] the beach leonardo dicaprio 8mm Apt Pupil BRINGING OUT THE DEAD The Sixth Sense Bruce Willis The Hustler Special WS Edition New Factory-Sealed ac-3 dolby digital 5.1collection box set schwartznegger criterion matrix special edtion japan japanese pilf-7405 fight club x-men godfather surround ld dts paul newman billiards pool laserdisc nicholas cage martin scorcese Movie Detail Summary: Chaplin 1992 - UK / USA - 144 min. - Feature, Color Director Richard Attenborough Genre/Type: Period Drama, Biography [feature], Drama MPAA Rating: R From book: Chaplin: His Life and Art; Chaplin: His life and Art, My Autobiography From story by: Diana Hawkins Set In: Hollywood Color type: Technicolor Sound by: Dolby Produced by: Carolco / Chaplin: His Life and Art / Japan Satellite Broadcasting / Le Studio Canal Plus / RCS Video / TriStar Release Dec 25, 1992 (USA) Released by TriStar Starring: Robert Downey, Jr. - Charlie Chaplin Dan Aykroyd - Mack Sennett Geraldine Chaplin - Hannah Chaplin Kevin Dunn - J. Edgar Hoover Anthony Hopkins - George Hayden Milla Jovovich - Mildred Harris Moira Kelly - Hetty Kelly/Oona O'Neill Kevin Kline - Douglas Fairbanks Diane Lane - Paulette Goddard Penelope Ann Miller - Edna Purviance Paul Rhys - Sydney Chaplin John Thaw - Fred Karno Marisa Tomei - Mabel Normand Nancy Travis - Joan Barry James Woods - Lawyer Scott Michael Blevins - David Raskin Francesca Buller - Minnie Chaplin Peter Crook - Frank Hooper David Duchovny - Rollie Totheroh Donnie Kehr - Sound Engineer Karen Lewis - Yankee Doodle Dancer Deborah Moore - Lita Grey Sean O'Bryan - Lewis Seeley Bill Paterson - Stage Manager Maria Pitillo - Mary Pickford Gerald Sim - Doctor John Standing - Chaplin Butler Robert Stephens - Ted the Drunk Norbert Weisser - German Diplomat Raymond Lynch - Bride's Father Malcolm Terris - Stallholder Ken Magee - Federal Marshal Jason Logan - Dinner Guest Brian Lipson - Warder Mark Long - Working Man Dennis Vero - Wedding Guest Annie Waterman - Party Guest Ralph Votrian - Reporter Jack Ritschel - William Randolph Hearst Tom Preston - Party Guest Bradley Pierce - Sydney Chaplin, Jr.--Age 6 Robert Peters - 'Great Dictator' cinematographer Stuart Richman - Barman Renata Scott - Dinner Guest Valorie Massalas Michael Miller - Reporter Heather McNair - Marion Davies J. Michael Patterson - Reporter P.H. Moriarty - Workhouse Official John Otrin - Reporter Tom Wright - Working Man Nicky Corello - Masseur Caroline Cornell Bryan Coleman - Drunk Joy Claussen - Dinner Guest Donald Elson - Prop Man Todd Mason Covert - Reporter Nick Edmett - Working Man Dana Craig - Federal Marshal Ann Fairlie - Wedding Guest Laura Bastianelli - Dinner Guest Iris Bath - Party Guest Michael Adler - Party Guest Alan Charof - Federal Marshall Michael Cade - Sydney Chaplin, Jr. Andre Bernard - Yankee Doodle Dancer Phil Brown - Projectionist Una Brandon-Jones - Inmate Howard Lew Lewis - Workhouse Official Charles Howerton - Dinner Guest William Hunt - US Maitre D' Mary Healey - Mrs. Karno Paul Hayes Emma Lewis - Production Assistant Richard James - Pianist Jayson Kane - Reporter Jerry Jenson - Hotel Porter Mike Fenton David Finch - Working Man Alan Ford - Warder Susie Figgis Caroline Guthrie - Courting Couple Michael Goorjian - Adult Charles Chaplin, Jr. Vicki Frederick - Party Guest Peter Georges - Groom David Gant - London Maitre d' Crew: Richard Attenborough - Producer / Director Mario Kassar - Producer William Boyd - Screenwriter Bryan Forbes - Screenwriter William Goldman - Screenwriter Diana Hawkins - Screenwriter / Associate Producer Sven Nykvist - Cinematographer John Barry - Composer (Music Score) Anne V. Coates - Editor Stuart Craig - Production Designer Norman Dorme - Art Director John King - Art Director Mark Mansbridge - Art Director Terence A. Clegg - Co-producer Chris A. Butler - Set Designer Stephenie McMillan - Set Designer Ellen Mirojnick - Costume Designer John Mollo - Costume Designer Kevin Jewison - Camera Operator Keith Campbell - Stunts George Marshall Ruge - Stunts Neil Summers - Stunts Jim Wilkey - Stunts Brian Williams - Stunts Description: Partly based on Charlie Chaplin's My Autobiography, this humorous and dramatic biopic features an all-star cast including Oscar nominee Robert Downey, Jr., Dan Aykroyd, Anthony Hopkins, Kevin Kline, Diane Lane, and Chaplin's real life daughter, Geraldine Chaplin, who portrays his mentally ill mother. With the use of flashback, an elderly Chaplin discusses his autobiography with his editor (Hopkins), who urges him to be more vulnerable and emotionally honest with his memoirs while journeying through his poverty-stricken childhood, closest friendships, many marriages, merciless pursuit by J. Edgar Hoover (Kevin Dunn), and Chaplin's ingenious invention of "The Little Tramp." Highlighted works such as The Gold Rush (1925) and The Great Dictator (1940) illustrate significant turning points in Chaplin's prolific filmography. Director Richard Attenborough's film also explores the circumstances surrounding Chaplin's exile from America and his eventual return to receive an honorary Academy Award. ? (Synopsis by: Lisa Kropiewnicki) The Academy Award-winning director of another biopic, Gandhi (1982), Richard Attenborough reveals his obvious reverence for the iconoclastic Charlie Chaplin in this critically if not commercially successful film. Robert Downey, Jr., who trained for over a year to replicate Chaplin's English cockney accent, tics and rhythm as well as his graceful balletic and athletic movements, physical humor, and posture, gives the star-making performance of his career and is riveting to watch as he brings to life one of the most influential people in the history of cinema. The film is a thoughtful mixture of melancholy and humor, juxtaposing Chaplin's private loneliness and loss with his professional comedic talents and fortitude. Spanning a period of nearly 80 years in the actor's life, the film has been criticized for trying to cover too much narrative ground, but given the enormity of Chaplin's contribution to his art and the personal obstacles he overcame, this is an enjoyable, emotional, and authentic film. From its rural Hollywood locations in the early 1900's and demonstration of early movie-making techniques to its superb cast, Chaplin (1992} is a potent tribute to a gifted cinematic artist. ? (Review by: Lisa Kropiewnicki] Awards: Best Actor (nom) Robert Downey, Jr. 1992 Academy Best Art Direction (nom) Stuart Craig 1992 Academy Best Art Direction (nom) Chris A. Butler 1992 Academy Best Score (nom) John Barry 1992 Academy Best Actor (nom) Robert Downey, Jr. 1992 British Academy Awards Best Costume Design (nom) 1992 British Academy Awards Best Makeup (nom) 1992 British Academy Awards Best Production Design (nom) Stuart Craig 1992 British Academy Awards Best Costume Design (nom) Ellen Mirojnick 1993 British Academy Awards Best Actor (Drama) (nom) Robert Downey, Jr. 1993 Golden Globe Best Original Score (nom) John Barry 1993 Golden Globe Best Supporting Actress (nom) Geraldine Chaplin 1993 Golden Globe Money Orders or Personal Checks or PAYPAL or BIDPAY accepted Buyer [with USA shipping address] pays flat $6.50 for shipping [usps priority or ups / delivery tracking and confirmation & insurance included] NON US BUYERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY AND ALL FEES/CHARGES [BANK/TRANSACTION/TAX ETC] WHICH ARE A RESULT OF NEGOTIATING THE INSTRUMENT OF PAYMENT note: BIDDERS WITHOUT A USA OR USA TERRITORY ADDRESS PAY ACTUAL SHIPPING COSTS PLUS AN ADDITIONAL 3 DOLLAR HANDLING FEE CLICK ON LINK BELOW TO FIND MORE RED-HOT RARE AC-3 / DOLBY DIGITAL LASERDISCS SUCH AS THE SIXTH SENSE, BRINGING OUT THE DEAD, APT PUPIL, 8MM . . . Item.Name: I Claudius - 7 VHS Box Set! NR
Item.Description: This incredible box set contains 7 VHS tapes (740 minutes in total) of one of the greatest television miniseries of all time -- I, Claudius. This superbly acted, mordantly funny romp through 70 years or so of Roman history is one of the best-loved miniseries ever made, and deservedly so. Derek Jacobi plays Roman Emperor Claudius, who reflects in old age on his life and his remarkable family, giving us a history lesson that's unlike anything you learned in school. The story begins in 24 B.C. during the reign of Augustus Caesar, Rome's first emperor, and ends in A.D. 54 with Nero on the throne. In between, I, Claudius details the scheming, murder, madness, and lust that passed for politics in the early years of the Pax Romana. Further acting honors go to George Baker as Tiberius and to John Hurt as a hilarious and absolutely terrifying Caligula. The topnotch cast and the incident-filled plot are more than enough to hold the attention through almost 11 hours of gripping, deliciously wicked Roman follies. This particular box set is in mint condition, as it has hardly been used. The tapes are all in perfect working order, and the box looks new. All in all, this collection is a wonderful addition to the library of any fan of historical drama and intrigue. He has to restore order to a town bullied by the sadistic sheriff, Tom Rile. Travis, always good with a pistol, must face Rile on his own violent level. Item.Description: You're bidding a rare 60 minute retrospective, and one of the best "making of" videos I've ever scene -from the current revival of the great classic -"42nd Street". Item.Name: MS. 45 Zoe Tamerlis vhs Edward Singer
Item.Description: Ms. 45 (1981) ( USA NTSC VHS Movie ) An offbeat and well-made independent drama that plays like a distaff "Death Wish." Item.Name: Jewel Nile, Romancing Stone, Star Trek vhs
Item.Description: ROMANCING THE STONE: One Reviewer Wrote: "Director Robert Zemeckis (Forrest Gump, Contact) had a hit with this 1984 comedy that first teamed Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner, and Danny DeVito. Turner steals the show from the guys, however, playing a pushy romance novelist who gets stuck among some dangerous figures in Colombia and has only a rumpled guide (Michael Douglas) as an ally. The chemistry between the stars is infectious (the trio went on to make a sequel, Jewel of the Nile, and then an interesting, dark comedy directed by DeVito, The War of the Roses). Zemeckis--whose specialty at the time was creating set pieces of raucous action (as in his Back to the Future)--keeps things hopping with lots of kinetic material. " Star Trek First Contact (c)1996 PG-13 111 Mins Starring: Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, James Cromwell previous rental. Synopsis: They call themselves the Borg - a half-organic, half-machine collective with a sole purpose: to conquer and assimilate all races. Led by their seductive and sadistic queen (Alice Krige), the Borg are headed to Earth with a devious plan to alter history. Picard's last encounter with the Borg almost killed him. Now, he wants vengeance. But how far will he go to get it? The Jewel of the Nile (1985) ( USA NTSC VHS Movie ) More thrilling comedy and hilarious adventure in "Romancing the Stone''s" hit sequel. Here Kathleen Turner, Michael Douglas and Danny DeVito find themselves in the middle of an Arabian revolution and must locate the mysterious "jewel." Chases, laughs, romance and danger galore. 106 min. Rated PG Director: Lewis Teague Cast: Danny DeVito, Michael Douglas, Spiros Focas, Holland Taylor, Kathleen Turner In great condition, Previous Block buster rental. This book looks new except for a cut on the upper corner of the front cover (shown). Book is an excellent condition. Ya gotta admit no other movie stressed fan participation the likes of which this one did, and even after decades The Rocky Horror Picture Show is still a fan favorite. It has been imitated but never duplicated!! This ones a keeper, and is in MINT condition!! Any Rocky Horror fan is sure to love this little treasure, as the poster looks "INCREDIBLE", and the grainy appearance of the scanned image does not do the piece any justice, as it looks beautiful up close!! The poster is super rich and glossy and is still rolled inside the plastic wrapping, this little gem hasn't been touched!! The poster measures about 24" X 34" and would make a wonderful piece for any Rocky Horror movie lover in the house. Item.Name: THE SCORE NEW DVD*DeNIRO*NORTON*BRANDO
Item.Description: Robert DeNiro, Edward Norton, Angela Bassett and Marlon Brando team up in THE SCORE an intriguing crime thriller that marks the first time that legendary Oscar winners Robert DeNiro and Marlon Brando have shared the screen. Also starring Oscar nominees Edward Norton and Angela Bassett. I don't want to give away too much of the plot as this film is one of the smartest, most entertaining crime capers ever filmed, with surprises at every turn. When expert safecracker Nick Wells (DeNiro) decides it might be time to settle down with his girlfriend (Angela Bassett), his friend and business partner Max (Brando) has other plans. Heavily in debt to a crime boss, Max needs Nick to pull one last heist: help novice thief Jack Teller (Norton) steal a scepter worth $30 million from the House of Customs. Tempted by the $6 million payday, Nick reluctantly agrees to do the job. But what starts out as a safe bet turns into a high risk gamble when a clash of egos threatens to bring them all down. What ensues is a top-notch heist movie that ratchets up the tension inch by careful inch proving an ingenius suspense caper. DVD is new, factory sealed widescreen collection loaded with special features. Winner takes care of $5.95 USPS Priority Delivery Confirmation & Handling. Item.Name: ALEXANDER & THE ....VERY BAD DAY - VHS NEW
Item.Description: US Shipping will be $1.50 NEW - Factory sealed! Alexander and the terrible, horrible, No good, Very bad day! This is a darling video based on the book by same title By Judith Viorst. About the video; _Hi! I_m Alexander. Did you ever have one of those days? A terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day? Well, I have. Today! Everything went wrong. I went to sleep with gum in my mouth and woke up with gum in my hair and when I got out of bed I tripped on the skateboard and by mistake I dropped my sweater in the sink while the water was running and all that was before I even went downstairs for breakfast. That does it I decided, _I think I_ll move to Australia._ I_ve been scolded and bullied and picked on an bossed around by my parents and my teacher and my big brothers and I even got a cavity. I should never have gotten out of bed._ _It_s been a terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day!_ _My mom says some days are like that. Even in Australia._ Delightfully animated and song filled story! Item.Name: #153 JIM THORPE ALL AMERICAN LC #2 '51
Item.Description: Bruce Hershenson Vintage Movie Posters and Movie Poster Books All 530 items we are selling this week have a $2.99 opening bid and NO RESERVE! No questions asked return policy on EVERY item! Best Packaging and Quickest Shipping on eBay! 99.978% customers satisfied in over 42,000 eBay transactions! Full-Time movie poster dealer since 1989; over 16 million dollars of sales! Publisher of 30 full-color movie poster books (over 220,000 copies sold)! What you are Bidding On: #153 JIM THORPE ALL AMERICAN LC #2 '51 Type of Item: Original Vintage Theater-Used Lobby Card #2 (Measures 11" x 14") Description: Jim Thorpe - All American, the 1951 Michael Curtiz Olympic decathlon sports biography of Jim Thorpe (the greatest athlete of all time, even though he was stripped of his Olympic medals) starring Burt Lancaster, Charles Bickford, Steve Cochran, and Phyllis Thaxter Note that this lobby card shows Lancaster as Thorpe in full football uniform surrounded by other players. Condition & Defects: very good. There is a tiny creased area in the right of the bottom border below the tiny writing at the bottom. There is a pinhole in the left corners and two in the top right corner. There is minor smudging in the blank borders and a stain in the right of the bottom blank border. Click here to learn how we describe the condition of our items. Lobby Cards measure 11" x 14" and were almost always printed in sets of 8 (some lower budget films only had a set of 4). Many lobby card sets (usually pre-1970 sets) have a "title card". A title card normally has artwork and the credits from the film, and is different in appearance from the other seven cards in the set. The artwork is usually the same as that of the artwork on one of the styles of half-sheet. It is very difficult to find complete lobby card sets from pre-1970 films, as almost all of these were long ago broken up and sold by the individual card. Click here to view the hundreds of other items we have for sale on eBay! Our Feedback Policy We only leave feedback on those who leave feedback on us. The reason we leave feedback in this manner is both because we don't consider a transaction "completed" until the buyer has decided they are happy with their purchase, and also because we sell so many items (usually 500+ a week) that it would require an extra employee if we had to leave feedback first, and that would mean raising our prices, which we don't want to do. All but a handful of our 10,000+ customers are understanding on this and are willing to leave feedback first. If you are one of the few people who insist on feedback being left as soon as you make payment, PLEASE DO NOT BID ON ANY OF OUR AUCTIONS. IMPORTANT! Please read our Shipping Terms before you place a bid on this item! U.S. only : Shipping is SEVEN DOLLARS ($7) , (unless the item is oversized, in which case shipping is $12, as would be clearly noted in the description above). NO MATTER HOW MANY OF OUR ITEMS YOU BUY THIS WEEK, YOU ONLY PAY A SINGLE SHIPPING CHARGE, AS LONG AS THEY FIT IN ONE PACKAGE. Click HERE to learn the excellent reasons we charge more than many eBay sellers do for shipping! We are not trying to make money on shipping charges, but we want to make sure every purchase arrives safely! OUR REGULAR SHIPPING CHARGES INCLUDES INSURANCE AND EXTRA-STRENGTH PACKAGING! NON-U.S. Orders: Click HERE to learn how much the shipping for this item is, before you place a bid. Sometimes it is relatively expensive to send an order to a non-U.S. destination. Orders from outside the U.S. must specify surface mail or Airmail, and they will be charged the actual postal cost only, plus $2 for packaging materials. Orders to Canada can only be sent via Airmail! Payment Options We accept Visa/MasterCard, Paypal, check, or money order. If you pay with cash, we are not responsible if the cash doesn't reach us safely! Almost all orders are sent within two business days of our receiving payment. Go to our About My Store page to learn about our huge selection of full-color movie poster books, to view over 2,000 free images of great vintage movie posters, and to learn how to join our free Weekly E-Mail Club for vintage movie poster collectors that has over 1700 members ! Every movie poster collector needs to learn how to avoid costly "mistakes" that almost every beginning collector makes, and our site (and our e-mail club) will help you avoid making such mistakes, and make you a better collector! Return Policy: If for any reason you are unhappy with your purchase, return it within one week (securely wrapped and insured) for a full refund of the purchase price, no questions asked! The colors from this film could knock your eyes out it's so vivid.The story line is MacLaine isn't happy with her marriage to a priggish bra manufacturer, so she keeps a lover in the attic. Item.Name: Madonna AUTO 8x10 Like a virgin hand signed
Item.Description: Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims, the families and friends of these horrible terrorist attacks. GOD BLESS AMERICA! GOD BLESS AND PROTECT OUR SOLDIERS! var theDay = new Date("December 25, 2001") //The day that you want to solve that it's how long from now. var DayTill //The string that is going to put all numbers together and make sense. { var today = new Date() //Create an Date Object that contains today's date. var second = Math.floor((theDay.getTime() - today.getTime())/1000) /*Use getTime() to get the milisecond (1/1000 of a second) from now to theDay. and devide it into 1000 to get the seconds from now to theDay.*/ var minute = Math.floor(second/60) //Devide "second" into 60 to get the minute var hour = Math.floor(minute/60) //Devide "minute" into 60 to get the hour var day = Math.floor(hour/24) //Devide "hour" into 60 to get the day CDay= day //Correct day CHour= hour % 24 //Correct hour, after devide into 24, the remainder deposits here. CMinute= minute % 60 //Correct minute, after devide into 60, the remainder deposits here. CSecond= second % 60 //Correct second, after devide into 60, the remainder deposits here. DayTill = CDay + " days, " + CHour + " hours, " + CMinute + " minutes and " + CSecond + " seconds " //Rewrite the string to the correct information. document.clock.countdown.value = DayTill //Make the particular form chart become "Daytill" var counter = setTimeout("countdown()", 1000) //Create the timer "counter" that will automatic restart function countdown() again every second. } //-- How many shopping days until Christmas? BID NOW!! A wonderful autographed photo of Madonna. It is hand signed. The photo comes with a COA, (certificate of authenticity), which is issued by Timeless Memories. Signature may vary due to digital image displayed. U. S. Only: Winning bidder pays $6.00 shipping, priority mail and delivery confirmation. Insurance Is Optional. Payments accepted are Money order, PayPal, (accepted only if a verified shipping address is included), and personal checks that must clear. Usually 2 weeks. I CAN NOT GURANTEE CHRISTMAS DELIVERY ON ITEMS PAID WITH A MONEY ORDER OR A PERSONAL CHECK. (DUE TO THE MAIL.) Thanks for looking and please view my other auctions for more wonderful autographed photos. Please ask all questions, as all sales are final. Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Item.Description: Bruce Hershenson Vintage Movie Posters and Movie Poster Books All 530 items we are selling this week have a $2.99 opening bid and NO RESERVE! What you are Bidding On: #314 A & C MEET THE INVISIBLE MAN LC #8 '51 Type of Item: Original Vintage Theater-Used Lobby Card #8 (Measures 11" x 14") Description: Abbott and Costello Meet the Invisible Man, the 1951 Charles Lamont horror comedy (loosely based on the classic H.G. Wells novel) starring Bud Abbott, Lou Costello and Nancy Guild Note that this card actually shows the Invisible Man wrapped in bandages, along with both Abbott and Costello! Condition & Defects: very good to fine. There is a pair of staple holes and a pencil mark in the top left corner and minor smudges in the blank borders. There are a few minor creases in the blank borders. Click here to learn how we describe the condition of our items. Lobby Cards measure 11" x 14" and were almost always printed in sets of 8 (some lower budget films only had a set of 4). Many lobby card sets (usually pre-1970 sets) have a "title card". A title card normally has artwork and the credits from the film, and is different in appearance from the other seven cards in the set. The artwork is usually the same as that of the artwork on one of the styles of half-sheet. It is very difficult to find complete lobby card sets from pre-1970 films, as almost all of these were long ago broken up and sold by the individual card. Item.Description: Bruce Hershenson Vintage Movie Posters and Movie Poster Books All 530 items we are selling this week have a $2.99 opening bid and NO RESERVE! No questions asked return policy on EVERY item! Best Packaging and Quickest Shipping on eBay! 99.978% customers satisfied in over 42,000 eBay transactions! Full-Time movie poster dealer since 1989; over 16 million dollars of sales! Publisher of 30 full-color movie poster books (over 220,000 copies sold)! What you are Bidding On: #402 COMMANDO CODY 1sh '53 sci-fi serial! Type of Item: Original Vintage Theater-Used Chapter #4 Folded One-Sheet (27" x 41") Description: From Chapter #4 of Commando Cody, the 1953 Franklin Adreon, Fred C. Brannon, & Harry Keller science fiction space serial starring Judd Holdren, Aline Towne, William Shallert, Richard Crane, and Grant Withers Condition & Defects: very good. There is some staining in the left of the chapter title box. There are minor creases in the blank border and a tack hole in each corner of the image background. The top blank border was folded back at one time. A 1 1/2" x 4" piece was torn off the bottom left corner but it is held on with tape from the back. There is a piece off the top left corner. Click here to learn how we describe the condition of our items. One-Sheets are the standard movie poster size, what you see outside of any movie theater. From 1896 until roughly 1990, almost all actual theater-used one-sheets measured 27" x 41" (since then, most one-sheets measure 27" x 40"). Up until 1980 (or thereabouts) the vast majority of one-sheets were folded twice horizontally and once vertically (this is in no way considered a defect). Sometime during the late '70s, studios began printing one-sheets rolled. Most one-sheets after the mid-1980s are printed unfolded, though it is still possible to find some newer posters folded. Most newer one-sheets are printed double-sided (with a mirror image on the back) for use in a light box in front of the theaters. However, sometimes the studios print some posters single-sided. All of the one-sheets (unless otherwise noted) being sold by eMoviePoster are original vintage theater-used one-sheets! Click here to view the hundreds of other items we have for sale on eBay! What you are Bidding On: #440 BLOOD DRINKERS 1sh '66 Fuentes, Remy Type of Item: Original Vintage Theater-Used Folded One-Sheet (27" x 41") Description: The Blood Drinkers, the 1966 Gerardo de Leon vampire horror film starring Amelia Fuentes, Ronald Remy, and Eddie Fernandez Condition & Defects: very good. Click here to learn how we describe the condition of our items. One-Sheets are the standard movie poster size, what you see outside of any movie theater. From 1896 until roughly 1990, almost all actual theater-used one-sheets measured 27" x 41" (since then, most one-sheets measure 27" x 40"). Up until 1980 (or thereabouts) the vast majority of one-sheets were folded twice horizontally and once vertically (this is in no way considered a defect). Sometime during the late '70s, studios began printing one-sheets rolled. Most one-sheets after the mid-1980s are printed unfolded, though it is still possible to find some newer posters folded. Most newer one-sheets are printed double-sided (with a mirror image on the back) for use in a light box in front of the theaters. However, sometimes the studios print some posters single-sided. All of the one-sheets (unless otherwise noted) being sold by eMoviePoster are original vintage theater-used one-sheets! Click here to view the hundreds of other items we have for sale on eBay!
